revision.comment: migrating [[Wikipedia:Persondata|Persondata]] to Wikidata, [[toollabs:kasparbot/persondata/|please help]], see [[toollabs:kasparbot/persondata/challenge.php/article/Mikhail Loginov|challenges for this article]]
revision.text:
{{Unreferenced|date=March 2007}} '''Mikhail Nikolayevich Loginov''' ({{lang-ru|Михаи́л Никола́евич Ло́гинов}}; November 21, 1903 in village of Ivanishinskiye Gorky (now in [[Staritsky District]], [[Tver Oblast]]) – October 28, 1940 in [[Miskhor]], [[Crimean Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic|Crimean ASSR]]) was a prominent [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] designer of anti-tank, air-defense, and other types of artillery, widely used during [[World War II]].
Being a chief of the designer bureau of 8th Kalinin Artillery plant in [[Korolyov (city)|Kaliningrad]] ([[Moscow Oblast]]), he created, among others, [[45-mm anti-tank gun M1937 (53-K)]], [[76-mm air-defense gun M1938]], [[37-mm air-defense gun M1939 (61-K)]], [[85-mm air-defense gun M1939 (52-K)]], [[25 mm automatic air defense gun M1940 (72-K)]].
For his achievements he was rewarded with [[Order of the Red Star]] (1937), [[Order of Lenin]] (1939), and [[USSR State Prize|Stalin Prize]] (1941, after his death).
{{DEFAULTSORT:Loginov, Mikhail}} [[Category:1903 births]] [[Category:1940 deaths]] [[Category:Russian people]] [[Category:Weapon designers]] [[Category:Russian inventors]] [[Category:Soviet people of World War II]] [[Category:Stalin Prize winners]]
{{USSR-bio-stub}}
